#summary How to compile HeeksCAD and HeeksCNC on Debian

Copypasta this into your nearest terminal:
{{{
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y subversion libopencascade-dev libwxgtk2.8-dev libgtkglext1-dev                
#press enter
svn checkout http://heekscad.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ heekscad
cd heekscad/src/
RUNINPLACE=yes make
}}}

If you want to use make install, remove 'RUNINPLACE=yes' and run make install after every 'make', and ignore the .so copy commands.

Wait a few minutes.


to add CAM capability:
{{{
cd ..
svn checkout http://heekscnc.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ heekscnc
cd heekscnc
mkdir PyCam/trunk
svn co https://pycam.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/pycam/trunk/pycam PyCam/trunk/pycam
cd src
RUNINPLACE=yes make
cd ../kurve
make
}}}

You probably will want to continue by building libarea and libactp for HeeksCNC

{{{
cd ../../../
svn checkout http://libarea.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ libarea
cd libarea
make
cp .libs/area.so ../heekscad/heekscnc/
}}}

{{{
cd ../
svn checkout http://libactp.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ libactp
cd libactp/PythonLib
make
cp .libs/actp.so ../../heekscad/heekscnc/
}}}

Then run HeeksCAD and add the HeeksCNC plugin (if you built it)

{{{
cd ../../heekscad/
PYTHONPATH="/your/absolute/path/to/heekscad/heekscnc/" ./HeeksCAD
}}}

If you did use make install, run it directly with 'HeeksCAD'.

Now do File->Plugins and click "..." and find libheekscnc.so.0.5.1 under heekscnc/

Restart HeeksCAD to load the plugin.
